I would recommend "Friday After Next" (1990) to you. It is a comedy movie directed by Ron Howard. The main character Craig is a security guard at a high school. On Christmas Eve, the school principal and his wife are murdered by a thief who stole their Christmas presents. Craig and his co-workers start an investigation into the murder and find out that the thief was actually one of the students who had been expelled from school for various reasons.
After finding out that the thief was one of the students who had been expelled from school for various reasons, Craig and his co-workers continue to investigate into the murder and eventually discover the true identity of the thief.

Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend watching "The Polar Express" and "The Way Back Home". 

"The Polar Express" is a classic holiday film that tells the story of a young boy named Peter who embarks on a magical adventure to the North Pole on the Polar Express. The film features an iconic scene where a train full of children approaches a frozen pond and, just as it approaches the edge of the pond, the train suddenly reverses direction and slides backwards down the slope of the pond and back into its original position at the other end of the pond. The scene has become one of the most iconic scenes ever featured in any film. 

"The Way Back Home" is another classic holiday film that tells the story of Spencer Krane who returns to the town where he was raised. It is the news that his grandmother has suffered a debilitating stroke that prompts his visit. What starts as a simple visit home becomes so much more. It becomes a journey of consequence. 

I hope you find these recommendations interesting and enjoyable to watch.
